byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London.

abstract: International Criminal Court judges sentence Faqi al-Madhi, member of Al Qaeda-affiliated group Ansar Dine, to nine years for role in 2012 demolition of historic Muslim shrines in Timbuktu, Mali; ruling marks court's first prosecution of destruction of cultural heritage as war crime.
